passes.description: Ensures the order of headings is semantically correct
passes.help: Heading levels should only increase by one

ancestry: html > body > div:nth-child(3) > div > div:nth-child(1) > header > div > div > div:nth-child(3) > nav > h2:nth-child(1)
html > body > div:nth-child(3) > div > main:nth-child(2) > div > section:nth-child(2) > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > h1:nth-child(1)
html > body > div:nth-child(3) > div > main:nth-child(2) > div > section:nth-child(2) > div > div > div:nth-child(2) > div > div > div > div > h2:nth-child(1)
html > body > div:nth-child(3) > div > footer:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(1) > div > div > div > div > h2:nth-child(1)
html > body > div:nth-child(3) > div > footer:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(2) > div > div > div > div > h2
html > body > div:nth-child(3) > div > footer:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(3) > div > div > div > div > h2:nth-child(1)
html > body > div:nth-child(3) > div > footer:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(4) > div > div > div > div > h2:nth-child(1)

any.message: Heading order valid

Fix any of the following:
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
